name: Scratch 2.0 Sprite File
summary: Learn about .SPRITE2 files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: Sprites are used by Scratch to perform actions within a project. Sprites can be created by users, but they are also available in the sprites library, as well.
To export a sprite, therefore creating the SPRITE2 file, right-click the sprite thumbnail, select save to local file, name the file, and choose the save location.
NOTE: The release of Scratch 2.0 introduced the SPRITE2 file, which replaced the .SPRITE file.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download
